oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Cyrus M. DeLany, Co. B, 30th Ohio Inf. Regt., USA to his brother.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: DeLany references "the running of the blockade by Union gunboats and three or four (don't know which) transports" on April 17, 1863. This is an obvious reference to Union ships running past the Confederate artillery batteries at Vicksburg, Mississippi. DeLany also requests that the folks back home send him extra stamps. DeLany survives the war and goes into the regular US Army in 1867 where he remained until his death in 1888. He primarily served in the 15th US Inf. Regt.
